definition: to love one's country as one's own family (praise for a virtuous ruler)
to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)
surname Guo
country/nation/state/national/CL:個|个[ge4]
as/as if/such as

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 傢伙|家伙[jia1 huo5]

sentences.english: And the attachment to the country mainly manifests in patriotic like family.
sentences.chinese: 对国家的依恋集中体现在爱国如家心态上。

definition: faithful patriots (idiom)
to dedicate oneself to the service of one's country
self-restraint and devotion to public duties (idiom); selfless dedication/to serve the public interest wholeheartedly
render service to repay kindness
for the common good and forgetting personal interests (idiom); to behave altruistically/selfless
to pursue public affairs
to be industrious and frugal (idiom)
to prove one's worth through firm resolve (idiom)
to love the common people as one's own children (praise for a virtuous ruler)
to dedicate oneself to the cause of one's country (idiom)
loyal and righteous/fealty/loyalty
lit. red-bellied devotion (idiom); wholehearted loyalty/to serve sb with body and soul
not corrupted by wealth and honors
those with lofty ideals (idiom)/men of vision
to give up life for righteousness (idiom, from Mencius); to choose honor over life/would rather sacrifice one's life than one's principles
brotherly bond
